title: Nothing I do helps. I feel unwanted. :(
post:
My husband and I are pretty much at the point of being roommates. I try and try and hint and doll myself up. I talk a little dirty to get the mood going, I send sexy photos to him, flash him randomly, walk around topless, wear lingerie around the house, etc. But lately it feels IMPOSSIBLE. 

I DID manage to get laid for 2 minutes the other day. It was the first 2 minutes since the last 2 minutes in October. He was drunk in October so I don’t even want to count it. We didn’t even have sex on our wedding anniversary last week!

How did I win these 2 minutes? By ONCE AGAIN telling him that I feel unattractive and unwanted to him. By telling him I crave touch and that closeness. That it’s not just sex to me. It’s that special connection that I get to have with one person out of over 7million on the planet. This whole pathetic argument is how I managed to score a whopping non-foreplay 2minutes of duty sex. 

The following day, we showered together. I tried to initiate by rubbing up against him and touching him.  He just jumped out of the shower to dry off. We used to shower and have sex every day! It’s bad enough that he NEVER innitates until I beg anymore. Then it’ll happen once and go back to the usual. 

 Today I mentioned how it’s too early to be wearing pants as he was throwing on jeans. I was sprawled out naked on the bed and trying to be a tease. He came up with every excuse under the sun. He said he has work at 4pm… It was 8am… He works 20 minutes away. SMH 

I’m tired of having to beg. And I tell myself I won’t say anything about it anymore but then it just builds up to the point I want to scream so I collect my thoughts and once again, calmly ask why without blame. What I can do better? How to be a better wife so maybe he’ll want me like he used to….

I can’t help but wonder if he’s cheating on me… If I knew marriage with no kids meant no sex, I would’ve never signed up! We are both 31 and used to be like rabbits. :(

He refuses to see a doctor and won’t tell me why so I’m left to assume. This SUCKS
label: Mental_Health

title: Fiction seeping into reality
post:
I love romantic novels. I never get tired of reading about yet another couple falling in love and consumate that love (in more or lesser extent). My wife though, tells me from time to time that I need no realize that reality (aka our marriage and her) is real, not the fiction that I am engrossed in. And I'm like, really?! Of course I know that, I'm no fool. 

But then I think to myself: wait, I do spend a lot of time feeling like I'm in love with a book, the love story, the main character(s), the author's writing, the feel of a story, the sex in a story, the romance a.o.. I think about it in between or after the reading, in other words: I think about it a lot. That must have some impact on my real life, right? But I don't know how to distinguish if or how that is true. 

Do do you experience this? Is reading romance getting 'in the way' of your real romantic life?

title: Fiction seeping into reality
post:

But I don't know how to distinguish if or how that is true. 

Do do you experience this? Is reading romance getting 'in the way' of your real romantic life?
parent_comment:
I doubt romance novels are seeping into your reality (only you know you and can answer that). But even I fall into the trap of using books (99% romance novels lol) as a “buffer” from my life, tough things I don’t want to think about and just to pass time when I don’t want to deal with things. 

It’s good to notice that and try to be more mindful with reading. People do it ALL the time with stuff (buffering)… Netflix, exercise, food, alcohol, social media, work… to distract from thoughts, feelings, things we don’t want to do. 

I always find myself getting into a book easier when I really need to clean lol
comment:
I am aware that I do use reading as a buffer. I can track back to the times where I've been reading more than other times. And it's usually during the times where I'm trying to escape something (this last period of reading frenzy was triggered by the pandemic and the world being on fire) that I read more. It's probably why I am wondering about it now. If it's 'just' that, or that I'm stuck in fiction fantasy. 

[Edit] And as an afterthought, if it's a bad thing to be stuck in fiction fantasy? Because it makes me happy reading romance and live in those worlds for a while. Though that sometimes feels like an addiction, you know. I don't want to problemize this feeling, I am conscious of what I'm doing. And I love reading romance novels! It's just, I don't know anybody around me who reads romance so that's why I'm asking here.
label: Interests

comment:
It sounds like (to me at least) that you really love reading romance novels and you use it as an escape from things at time (this is sooooo me)… it doesn’t sound like you’re not “living in reality”? 

It does seem like there’s a concern with you saying it’s “your addiction” as in you may ignore your wife or other things because of your reading? It may be beneficial to have some self made boundaries on reading. I could read the day away,  but make sure I only read before my kiddos wake up, over nap time or if they are playing elsewhere in the house. I also try to get certain tasks done before reading (cleaning tasks, shower, etc)

title: Can anyone relate ?
post:
So I’ve been diagnosed with adhd at the age of 10 or so. I took pills until I was 12 and then stopped Bc my mom said I grew out of it. 

Well I’m 20 now and I don’t think my ADHD ever kicked this hard 🤡

Does anyone else get those hyper focus phases ? 

For instance, I will play sims 4 for 3 months straight, nothing else. Then I would get into animal crossing again and boom playing for 3 months straight. Then I’m thinking I could easily build a miniature house, well that lastet 3 days, I would be working on that for 12 h straight. I be staring so many things like dancing, horse riding etc but then just stop Bc the hyper focus is over. 

Or at 3 am I be making a list of what I’ll be cleaning, cooking or doing tomorrow. We’ll never happens 

Or I’ll be mid sentence and then just suddenly talk about something else that just shoot into my brain. 

Or I have 5 topics in my head that I want to express at the same time. 


So can someone relate 😅 if yes, what do you do about these things ?
label: Health

title: Do you change any of your edc items for special occasions?
post: I was wondering if it was normal to change out your regular worn out equipment for something more presentable when you are in a formal area, or at least only openly carry something more fancy so that you don't ruin your attire? It seems like this would be a small, but respectful change to your equipment.
comment: I usually carry a Victorinox alox pioneer in a small leather slip sheath when I’m dressed up. It’s thin enough to not be uncomfortable in a suit pocket or even in slacks.  gets the job done at weddings and such where you may need to cut a tag on clothing or open a bottle of beer.
disclosure: Victorinox alox pioneer in a small leather slip sheath
label: Possession

title: Do you change any of your edc items for special occasions?
post: I was wondering if it was normal to change out your regular worn out equipment for something more presentable when you are in a formal area, or at least only openly carry something more fancy so that you don't ruin your attire? It seems like this would be a small, but respectful change to your equipment.
comment:
Yup. I usually have a belt pouch with knife and flashlight (Nebo Torchy and Kershaw Blur). Weekends and casual-but-not work, I have a nicer pouch, I'll swap out the knife and flashlight (Olight Baton 3 Limited Edition - Eternal, and CJRB Feldspar button-lock), and include a pen.  Really nice events like weddings, I'll forgo the pouch, and do a pen light (usually Nebo Inspector RC) and a CRKT CEO in the jacket pocket.

It's like switching from your smartwatch to a nice analog one for the occasion.
disclosure: I usually have a belt pouch with knife and flashlight (Nebo Torchy and Kershaw Blur

I'm a lady so any VERY formal occasion means tiny clutch purse so no flashlight, no pack of cards, no prybar, no small container of sunscreen, no back up knife, no firestarter...formal event is tube of lipstick, a stick of eyeliner and a folding knife if I'm lucky.

I like the idea of swapping to like, a black tie event knife, but I'm never gonna open my clutch purse to show anybody my small fancy person knife.

title: Quit riding/ racing in 2019, just bought a Kickr and replacement parts for the ol shred sled, I'm back!

title: Custom golfer appearance deleted/reset when changes are made to a guest player appearance?
post: Title basically explains it. My wife created a golfer, and I play with the "guest 1" profile. At least 3 times, if I change the appearance/gear/apparel of "guest 1", my wife's player appearance (she's the main player btw) totally resets to a pre-made appearance. Her clothes, her gender, her gear, all reset and she has to remake her character each time. The only thing that doesn't change is her player name and national flag.
label: Wife_GF

title: Should I keep taking the antibiotics?
post:
33F, I started having UTI symptoms (bladder discomfort, frequent urge to urinate, lower back pain) on Christmas and had a virtual appointment with a provider who prescribed me Macrobid (nitrofurantoin). The next day I went to urgent care as the back pain had gotten worse and they did a urinalysis (showed negative) and sent off for a urine culture. 

The culture came back today showing no growth or evidence of a UTI. I’m still feeling symptoms though, particularly bladder irritation and frequent urge to urinate. The doctor basically said it’s up to me if I want to continue taking the macrobid. I’m halfway through the course. Should I finish it?
label: Health

comment: I'm a male who also has the urge to urinate, and I've had it periodically for years. Ibuprofen really helps - I was told I may have interstitial cystitis, but it was a super weak diagnosis. Historically if I take ibuprofen for a few days, the urge to urinate is cured and doesn't come back (at least not for weeks/months). The reason I was given is ibuprofen reduces inflammation, and if your bladder is overactive or inflamed for no reason this would fix it. It can be caused by diet, so if you ate anything unusual recently that would be good to note!

title: Possible runners knee?
post: I \[20M\] havent run in the past 2 years, now i started running and 2 days in i felt a burning sensation above the outer side of my knee (on that muscle of tendon band) so i took a day of and went back the 2 days after but this time my hole knee hurt but i pushed through it thinking it was from the long time i've spent not exercising until it hurt so bad that it slowed me down at first now i cant run properly.

title: [Looking for] 26F looking for a room or roommates starting 3/1 or 4/1
post:
Hi! I might be looking too early, but I wanted to post anyway—I’m 26F looking for a room in Brooklyn starting 3/1 or 4/1, preferably Bushwick or Williamsburg. I’m pretty open to exploring other options, though. My max budget is $1500. 

A little about myself: I work remotely Mon-Fri as a copywriter. I love going to music events and hanging out with friends, but I also enjoy having nights in and watching TV or a movie. My Top Spotify Artists of 2022 were Charli XCX, Taylor Swift, Carly Rae Jepsen, Snow Strippers, and Danny L Harle. 

I also enjoy becoming friends with the people I live with, but if we just keep to ourselves and create a comfortable living space that’s fine, too! If you think we’d get along as roommates, please shoot me a PM, I’d love to chat more.
label: Age_Gender

title: Temporary Anxiety immediately after taking?
post: Has anyone had anxiety / slight depression / negative thinking mini episodes roughly 30-45 minutes after taking 80 milligrams of Latuda? My husband has decided to leave me.

We have been together 15years and married 5. I realize now that he was never committed to this marriage

When I said i do..it was through thick and thin. Now he wants to go out and live his life as he has become bored with his life

I am not able to sleep
I don't eat

I started seeing a therapist

But i want to know those it get better when you lose your person

comment: I am so sorry you are going through this. I was with my husband for 13 years when he decided to leave me just over 2 months ago now. I went through the same thing (and still kinda do). Not sleeping well (he also still cohabitates since we have kids, and he’s still in the bed, very awk), not eating well, not exercising the way I used to, not caring to make plans or do anything.  Some days are ok, some days are just terrible. Music triggers me. Tv/movies trigger me. It’s going to be very bad before getting better. And then loneliness is going to set in, and I fear that will be the worst stage for us. Honestly, I don’t think it gets better, you will learn how to cope and what helps to push those sad, angry, frustrated feelings aside. You will get stronger mentally and emotionally. It’s day by day. Individual to individual. It’s hard. And it hurts. I’m starting to care less and less as the days go on. Some days I still sit and think how he can just leave his family behind, but at this point, i won’t change his mind and I’ve already apologized for everything on my end and, shamefully, begged him back with no success. I have to keep trooping on. And so do u. Take baby steps.
disclosure: I was with my husband for 13 years when he decided to leave me just over 2 months ago now

title: Does it really get better?
post:
My husband has decided to leave me.

We have been together 15years and married 5. I realize now that he was never committed to this marriage

But i want to know those it get better when you lose your person
comment: I have been divorced twice due to infidelity on their part. My first ex was very contrite and made a strong effort to make amends post divorce. She offered me closure and we are now friends. My 2nd ex, not so much. I had to create my own closure and move forward. Life does get better. In fact, you can be the best version of yourself. This experience will make you both stronger and more vulnerable at the same time. Therapy is a great start. It will help you navigate and articulate your emotions. Take this time to get reacquainted with yourself. Figure out who you are and what you really want. Allow yourself to grieve the end of the relationship. It will be a rollercoaster of emotions, but you have to tough it out. Don’t try to avoid it. Talk to other friends or family that have experienced a divorce. Whatever you do, do not give in to anger, fear and resentment after the dust settles. It’s an easy path of self destruction. Know your worth and rise above. It does get better and it does get easier, but you do have to put in the work. You got this it. I wish you the best on your new journey.

comment:
I would say yes, it does get easier.  I am the one who walked after 34 years together and 30 married. It wasn't easy doing this, I'm fortunate at 54 to have my mum providing me a home whilst my divorce goes through and home sale is completed.

I pretty much had a nervous breakdown for the first 4 weeks, couldn't function at all. I'm now seeing that a new life can be carved, nothing fancy, no new partner, just me and myself.  

I wish you well for the future and connect with people, use other sites for practical and emotional support as this is one big situation which should not be underestimated on the impact it has on us.  Be kind to yourself and try and maintain good physical health which should support your emotions.

comment:
It does get better.  After 15 years together, we have now been separated for 6 months.  It was a shock to my system when she left and she took the kids as well. 

I'm devastated that I only see my kids a few days each week but I'm counting on the courts to rectify that.  I am also devastated that my best friend and confidante has now decided she never loved me.

But it does get better.  Live in the present, allow the mental model of "how life should be" to change to "how life now is" and treat each cry session as a step in the healing process.  Don't obsess with the why...make yourself whole and rebuild the next chapter of your life in such a way that you can love yourself and eventually someone new can share love with you too.
disclosure: After 15 years together, we have now been separated for 6 months.
label: Relationship_Status

title: Exercising with joint problems
post: I’m looking for advice/support from others in a similar situation or who know about it.  I have fibromyalgia on top of hyper-mobility syndrome, it’s really painful and when I’m not in a flare up just normal exercise like walking, cycling etc… hurts (in a flare up just daily activities are a struggle), plus for normal people their muscles might ache for a couple of days after, it can take a week or more for my pain to ease to an acceptable level.  I hate it, I’m on various pain killers to target the different causes of the pain, my rheumatologist has said jogging/running is a definite no due to my main issues being in my knees and hips.  I’m very overweight, I know exercise is the key as well as diet, I’ve lost a stone through diet changes but I need to exercise more.  I’ve tried yoga which is good but it doesn’t get the heart pumping!  I’m a nurse, I work 13 hour shifts and I’m a mum to 2 young girls, I’m not lazy as people sometimes presume when they hear fibromyalgia.  So if anyone has any exercise tips for a total newbie and with these conditions (plus severe asthma if that makes a difference) I’d love your help.  If you’ve read this far but can’t help, thank you for listening.
label: Health

I hate it, I’m on various pain killers to target the different causes of the pain, my rheumatologist has said jogging/running is a definite no due to my main issues being in my knees and hips.  I’m very overweight, I know exercise is the key as well as diet, I’ve lost a stone through diet changes but I need to exercise more.  I’ve tried yoga which is good but it doesn’t get the heart pumping!  I’m a nurse, I work 13 hour shifts and I’m a mum to 2 young girls, I’m not lazy as people sometimes presume when they hear fibromyalgia.  So if anyone has any exercise tips for a total newbie and with these conditions (plus severe asthma if that makes a difference) I’d love your help.  If you’ve read this far but can’t help, thank you for listening.
disclosure: I’m a nurse, I work 13 hour shift
label: Occupation

comment: Hey there, I experience hyper mobility and fibromyalgia too. The biggest game changers for me are learning properly about pacing and self compassion when it comes to movement and pain. Also, I imagine you are exhausted-your job is so full on. Doing yoga or other strengthening things is actually really excellent because it will help you have a strong foundation without completely wearing you out. Also, I’ve found Nordic walki g really helpful as it’s so supportive.

title: Switched Home Insurance due to increase in premium on 12/8 - How long does it take for Escrow Adjustment to Take Place?
post:
Hi all;

Hoping you can help a new home-owner with a situation.

My loan was transferred to a New Bank and when that happened ... An escrow adjustment was made at the end of November, I received a notification from Geico that my Premium increased from 1440 to about 2850!!! (Shitty ass HomeSite Company Geico affiliates with).  I found that the increase was **not** due to property tax - just the insurance company overpricing.

So I left Geico for State Farm first week of Dec.  My new insurance and paperwork was accepted by my Bank on 12/8.  I called the bank **each and every week** asking for the escrow to again be adjusted as I have a 60 day grace period where no late fees would be applied so I wanted to see if I could get my mortgage payment readjusted before I started paying again.

Fast forward to 12/29 and this was still not completed.  So my question is what can I do about this besides tracking the extra money I am paying based on my old insurance and hoping for a refund once they actually do the job I asked them to do back in early December?  I am just wondering if I missed something here in terms of pushing for the escrow as I did request this multiple times.  Unfortunately I paid my Nov and Dec Mortgage, but I am keeping all the information hoping I get refunded back the extra money I am paying.

Any advice would be much appreciated ... Thank you.  I feel I was screwed pretty good here.
disclosure: I received a notification from Geico that my Premium increased from 1440 to about 2850
label: Finance

label: Personal_Experiences

title: What is this called? And why?
post: Why is it when I experience something traumatic I feel 0 emotions? Like my father dying, or witnessing a gruesome argument/fight?
comment:
I do the same, or laugh. The true, raw emotion always comes later for me. It’s just how we be, OP. Doesn’t necessarily mean anything bad.

When I lost my last job, I laughed when they told me and they asked if I thought it was funny. Nope, just how I deal with things.
label: Personal_Experiences

title: What is this called? And why?
post: Why is it when I experience something traumatic I feel 0 emotions? Like my father dying, or witnessing a gruesome argument/fight?
comment: PTSD causes me to shut down in stressful events. I'm not a doctor by any means, but I think that you're shutting down because your brain is trying to keep yourself alive in what it sees as a threatening situation. It shuts down your fight or flight and essentially stops "recording" so that you can focus on your survival. I view my trauma like I'm watching a movie because my brain fully disconnected me from the experiences. Triggers cause my brain to return to that moment, attached with the emotions I should have felt then. Having flashbacks of traumatic events months after the event is usually how people discover that they have PTSD, because suddenly that apathetic disconnect becomes overwhelmingly personal. I wish you the best and it can be helpful to learn PTSD coping skills for any kind of trauma whether it causes PTSD or not. Good luck and stay safe.
disclosure: PTSD causes me to shut down
label: Health

title: What is this called? And why?
post: Why is it when I experience something traumatic I feel 0 emotions? Like my father dying, or witnessing a gruesome argument/fight?
comment: I too live in apathy. It's a double edge sword.
